III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/17/24, Youth B touched Youth A’s genitals, making Youth A
feel uncomfortable.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
03/19/2024.
Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant on 03/21/2024 via telephone, no
additional information provided.
I interviewed Chief Administrator at the agency on 03/21/2024.
Chief Administrator reported there was an incident on 03/17/2024
involving Youth A taking Youth B’s snack, staff and the Therapist
were supervising, and they did not observe anything inappropriate
between the two youths. Chief Administrator said on 03/19/2022
Youth A reported to Supervisor 1 that on 03/17/2024 Youth B tried
to take a snack bag from Youth A when Youth B touched Youth
A’s private area and made Youth A feel uncomfortable. Chief
Administrator reported the incident to MDHHS Analyst (PREA).
Chief Administrator said she spoke with the Therapist that was
present during the incident and the Therapist denied seeing any
inappropriate touching occur between the two youths. Chief
Administrator said the incident occurred in the classroom and Staff
1 and the Therapist were with the two Youths. Youth B was
discharged from the agency on 03/20/2024 to her parent and
therefore the two youths have not had contact. There was no
video footage of the incident. Chief Administrator said the
Therapist wrote a statement after Youth A made a comment about
the incident to Supervisor 1.
I interviewed Youth A at the agency on 03/21/2024. Youth A is 17
years old and has been at the agency for one month. Youth A said
2

there was an incident involving her and Youth B, but nothing
happened. Youth A took Youth B’s cookies and Youth B tried to
grab them from Youth A. Youth A denied being touched in the
genital area by Youth B. Youth A said Staff 1 was supervising and
the Therapist was on the pod. Youth A said she told Supervisor 1
nothing happened, and she only said Youth B touched her private
area because she was mad at Youth B. Youth A refused to
answer any questions and walked out of the room.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 03/21/2024 at the agency.
Supervisor 1 reported on 03/19/2024 Youth A told her she felt
uncomfortable during an incident when Youth B tried to take a bag
of cookies that she had put under her shirt. Supervisor 1 said she
immediately notified the manager and director of the incident.
Supervisor 1 said she later questioned Youth A about the incident
and Youth A told her she lied and only said this because she was
mad at Youth B.
I interviewed Therapist on 03/21/2024 at the agency. Therapist
reported she was on the pod on 03/17/2024 and she observed
Youth A and Youth B in the classroom playing around over a bag
of cookies. She said Youth A had grabbed two bags of cookies,
stuck them under her shirt, and Youth B attempted to grab the bag
of cookies from Youth A. Staff 1 was in the classroom with the two
youths. The two youths were redirected to stop playing around.
She denied any inappropriate touching occurred and staff were
supervising. Therapist said she spoke with Youth A after the
incident and Youth A didn’t report being touched or feeling
uncomfortable.
I interviewed Manager on 03/21/2024 at the agency. Manager
reported on 03/19/2024 Yourh A reported to Supervisor 1 that on
03/17/2024 Youth B touched her genital area during a dispute
over a bag of cookies and made her feel uncomfortable. Manager
reported staff and therapist were on the pod and they both
reported they did not observe anything inappropriate happen
between Youth A and Youth B. He denied any previous incidents
of any inappropriate touching by Youth A or Youth B.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the agency on 03/21/2024. Staff 1 recalled
the incident and reported she was in the classroom with Youth A
and Youth B. She said Youth A grabbed two bags of cookies and
Youth B tried to grab a bag of cookies from Youth A. Youth A put
the bags of cookies under her shirt. She denied witnessing Youth
B touch Youth A inappropriately. She redirected the two youths to
stop and nothing else happened. Staff 1 said Youth A did not
3

report anything to her after the incident. Staff 1 said the two
youths were playing around and nothing happened, so she is not
sure why Youth A made the comment two days after the incident.
I interviewed MDHHS Analyst on 03/21/2024 via telephone.
MDHHS Analyst reported the Chief Administrator informed her of
the incident involving Youth A on 03/20/2024. MDHHS Analyst
expressed no concerns regarding the agency or staff supervision.
I attempted to interview Youth B via telephone on 04/24/2024,
Youth B’s mother refused to allow Youth B to be interviewed.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Unusual Incident report dated 03/19/2024, written by
Supervisor 1. Youth A reported to Supervisor 1 that on
03/17/2024 Youth B touched her inappropriately while
attempting to retrieve a snack from under her shirt.
• Written statement from Therapist, dated 03/19/2024. The
statement is consistent with Therapist interview.
• Court Order discharging Youth B on 03/20/2024 to her
parents.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews there was sufficient supervising. Furthermore, Youth A
admitted she lied about being touched in the genital area.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
